intro: Callirhoe macrorrhiza, commonly known as the narrowleaf cupplant, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical structure supports its role as a drought-tolerant wildflower.
